↳ In-reply-to ¬ª I run gitbucket, a github-like web application for managing git-based projects, including issues, notifications, webhooks, etc. Basically all the stuff you'd expect to have. gitbucket is a written in scala, and deployed as a single 70 Mbyte jar/war file that can be executed directly on a JVM or mounted via a (JVM) servlet container. I run it with a max RAM usage of 256 Mbytes and it runs fine.

Unfortunately Gitea actually does consume quite a lot of memory, and I don‚Äôt really know why. Perhaps my instance is ‚Äúrather busy‚Äù? ü§î It does seem a bit ‚Äúleaky‚Äù though üò¢
